content.description: Just left of the large slab is a tiny cave. Start sitting with your hands on great triangular holds inside, and climb out of the overhang avoiding the flakes out left. After pulling the mini-roof, finish the easy slab and top out.
content.protection: Single pad is useful, especially if you are shaky after pulling the mini-roof.
content.location: Left of the large slab, under a bulging overhang.

content.description: On the flakes just left of Pile Driver, start on the lowest easy holds and climb left and up, staying just right of the tree. Follow the direct line to the easy topout.
content.protection: Pad or two if you are uncomfortable with the topout.
content.location: Left of Pile Driver, right of a tree.

content.description: Any of the obvious crack lines run at most V0, crux is just before topping out. Mostly VB. No roped climbing in CP---so no granting of more difficulty-appropriate YDS grades. Watch out for wetness. Don't ruin CP bouldering by falling.
content.protection: Don't fall if you like ur legs
content.location: You'll know it when you see it.

content.description: Called Blob in the Gaz Leah guide and Flounder in Gunks App. Climb the obvious crack in the boulder.
content.location: On the boulder with a lone crack in it, on the west end of the Shit Rock area.

content.description:
Secluded and often full of litter, the Shit Rock area is dominated by a 17-foot slab covered in flaring cracks. There are numerous V0  highball problems on this face, but the best climbing is on the rocks surrounding the slab. To the east of the slab is a tiny cave, and to the west is an impressive boulder hanging over a stone staircase. 

  Shit rock is a good place to put in mileage on the rock by going up and down or left and right on the large slab.
